item.title: A sane mini-tutorial for the Jenkins Javascript API
item.description: Holy moly, the Jenkins documentation is bad. At the very least, it isn’t very user-friendly, especially for beginners. For someone who has little-to-no experience in web development, doing something as simple as getting some job data from a Node program is the equivalent of pulling teeth. After spending hours in rabbit holes, I finally stumbled on a configuration that works. This mini-writeup will hopefully help those webdev-challenged folks such as myself in the quest for Jenkins API usage.
